member.name: T:RdpConnection.AzureVirtualDesktopProperties
member.summary: This class represents the properties of an Azure Virtual Desktop connection.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.AzureVirtualDesktopProperties.TargetIsAadJoined
member.summary: Connect to Microsoft Entra joined host
member.remarks: Allows connections to Microsoft Entra joined session hosts using username and password. Note that only applicable to non - Windows clients and local Windows devices that aren't joined to Microsoft Entra. This property is being replaced by the property enablerdsaadauth.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.AzureVirtualDesktopProperties.KdcProxyName
member.remarks: Specifies the fully qualified domain name of a KDC proxy.

member.name: T:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids
member.summary: Device setup class GUIDs are used to install devices. These GUIDs are defined by Microsoft for use in INF files.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids.DisplayName
member.summary: Display name of the device setup class.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids.ClassName
member.summary: Class name of the device setup class.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids.ClassGuid
member.summary: Class GUID of the device setup class.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids.Description
member.summary: Description of the device setup class.

member.name: M:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids.ToString
member.summary: The string representation of the device setup class.

member.name: F:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids.AudioProcessingObject
member.remarks: This class includes Audio processing objects (APOs). For more info, see Windows Audio Processing Objects.

member.name: F:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids.Battery
member.remarks: This class includes battery devices and UPS devices.

member.name: F:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids.Biometric
member.remarks: (Windows Server 2003 and later versions of Windows) This class includes all biometric-based personal identification devices.

member.name: F:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids.Bluetooth
member.remarks: (Windows XP SP1 and later versions of Windows) This class includes all Bluetooth devices.

member.name: F:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids.Camera
member.remarks: (Windows 10 version 1709 and later versions of Windows) This class includes universal camera drivers.

member.name: F:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids.CDROM
member.remarks: This class includes CD-ROM drives, including SCSI CD-ROM drives. By default, the system's CD-ROM class installer also installs a system-supplied CD audio driver and CD-ROM changer driver as Plug and Play filters.

member.name: F:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids.DiskDrive
member.remarks: This class includes hard disk drives. See also the HDC and SCSIAdapter classes.

member.name: F:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids.Display
member.remarks: This class includes video adapters. Drivers for this class include display drivers and video miniport drivers.

member.name: F:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids.Extension
member.remarks: (Windows 10 and later versions of Windows) This class includes all devices requiring customizations. For more details, see Using an Extension INF File.

member.name: F:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids.FDC
member.remarks: This class includes floppy disk drive controllers.

member.name: F:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids.FloppyDisk
member.remarks: This class includes floppy disk drives.

member.name: F:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids.HDC
member.remarks: This class includes hard disk controllers, including ATA/ATAPI controllers but not SCSI and RAID disk controllers.

member.name: F:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids.HIDClass
member.remarks: This class includes interactive input devices that are operated by the system-supplied HID class driver. This includes USB devices that comply with the USB HID Standard and non-USB devices that use a HID minidriver. For more information, see HIDClass Device Setup Class. (See also the Keyboard or Mouse classes later in this list.)

member.name: F:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids.Dot4
member.remarks: This class includes devices that control the operation of multifunction IEEE 1284.4 peripheral devices.

member.name: F:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids.Dot4Print
member.remarks: This class includes Dot4 print functions. A Dot4 print function is a function on a Dot4 device and has a single child device, which is a member of the Printer device setup class.

member.name: F:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids._61883
member.summary: IEEE 1394 Devices That Support the 61883 Protocol
member.remarks: This class includes IEEE 1394 devices that support the IEC-61883 protocol device class. The 61883 component includes the 61883.sys protocol driver that transmits various audio and video data streams over the 1394 bus. These currently include standard/high/low quality DV, MPEG2, DSS, and Audio. These data streams are defined by the IEC-61883 specifications.

member.name: F:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids.AVC
member.summary: IEEE 1394 Devices That Support the AVC Protocol
member.remarks: This class includes IEEE 1394 devices that support the AVC protocol device class.

member.name: F:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids.SBP2
member.summary: IEEE 1394 Devices That Support the SBP2 Protocol
member.remarks: This class includes IEEE 1394 devices that support the SBP2 protocol device class.

member.name: F:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids._1394
member.remarks: This class includes 1394 host controllers connected on a PCI bus, but not 1394 peripherals. Drivers for this class are system-supplied.

member.name: F:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids.Image
member.remarks: This class includes still-image capture devices, digital cameras, and scanners.

member.name: F:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids.Infrared
member.remarks: This class includes infrared devices. Drivers for this class include Serial-IR and Fast-IR NDIS miniports, but see also the Network Adapter class for other NDIS network adapter miniports.

member.name: F:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids.Keyboard
member.remarks: This class includes all keyboards. That is, it must also be specified in the (secondary) INF for an enumerated child HID keyboard device.

member.name: F:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids.MediumChanger
member.remarks: This class includes SCSI media changer devices.

member.name: F:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids.MTD
member.remarks: This class includes memory devices, such as flash memory cards.

member.name: F:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids.Modem
member.remarks: This class includes modem devices. An INF file for a device of this class specifies the features and configuration of the device and stores this information in the registry. An INF file for a device of this class can also be used to install device drivers for a controllerless modem or a software modem. These devices split the functionality between the modem device and the device driver. For more information about modem INF files and Microsoft Windows Driver Model (WDM) modem devices, see Overview of Modem INF Files and Adding WDM Modem Support.

member.name: F:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids.Monitor
member.remarks: This class includes display monitors. An INF for a device of this class installs no device driver(s), but instead specifies the features of a particular monitor to be stored in the registry for use by drivers of video adapters. (Monitors are enumerated as the child devices of display adapters.)

member.name: F:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids.Mouse
member.remarks: This class includes all mouse devices and other kinds of pointing devices, such as trackballs. That is, this class must also be specified in the (secondary) INF for an enumerated child HID mouse device.

member.name: F:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids.Multifunction
member.remarks: This class includes intelligent multiport serial cards, but not peripheral devices that connect to its ports. It does not include unintelligent (16550-type) multiport serial controllers or single-port serial controllers (see the Ports class).

member.name: F:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids.Media
member.remarks: This class includes Audio and DVD multimedia devices, joystick ports, and full-motion video capture devices.

member.name: F:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids.MultiportSerial
member.remarks: This class includes intelligent multiport serial cards, but not peripheral devices that connect to its ports. It does not include unintelligent (16550-type) multiport serial controllers or single-port serial controllers (see the Ports class).

member.name: F:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids.Net
member.remarks: This class consists of network adapter drivers. These drivers must either call NdisMRegisterMiniportDriver or NetAdapterCreate. Drivers that do not use NDIS or NetAdapter should use a different setup class.

member.name: F:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids.NetClient
member.remarks: This class includes network and/or print providers. Note that NetClient components are deprecated in Windows 8.1, Windows Server 2012 R2, and later.

member.name: F:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids.NetService
member.remarks: This class includes network services, such as redirectors and servers.

member.name: F:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids.NetTrans
member.remarks: This class includes NDIS protocols CoNDIS stand-alone call managers, and CoNDIS clients, in addition to higher level drivers in transport stacks.

member.name: F:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids.SecurityAccelerator
member.remarks: This class includes devices that accelerate secure socket layer (SSL) cryptographic processing.

member.name: F:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids.PCMCIA
member.remarks: This class includes PCMCIA and CardBus host controllers, but not PCMCIA or CardBus peripherals. Drivers for this class are system-supplied.

member.name: F:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids.Ports
member.remarks: This class includes serial and parallel port devices. See also the MultiportSerial class.

member.name: F:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids.Printer
member.remarks: This class includes printers.

member.name: F:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids.PNPPrinters
member.remarks: This class includes SCSI/1394-enumerated printers. Drivers for this class provide printer communication for a specific bus.

member.name: F:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids.Processor
member.remarks: This class includes processor types.

member.name: F:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids.SCSIAdapter
member.remarks: This class includes SCSI HBAs (Host Bus Adapters) and disk-array controllers.

member.name: F:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids.Securitydevices
member.remarks: (Windows 8.1, Windows 10) This class includes Trusted Platform Module chips. A TPM is a secure crypto-processor that helps you with actions such as generating, storing, and limiting the use of cryptographic keys. Any new manufactured device must implement and enable TPM 2.0 by default. For more information, see TPM Recommendations.

member.name: F:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids.Sensor
member.remarks: (Windows 7 and later versions of Windows) This class includes sensor and location devices, such as GPS devices.

member.name: F:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids.SmartCardReader
member.remarks: This class includes smart card readers.

member.name: F:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids.SoftwareComponent
member.remarks: (Windows 10 version 1703 and later versions of Windows) This class includes virtual child device to encapsulate software components. For more details, see Adding Software Components with an INF file.

member.name: F:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids.Volume
member.remarks: This class includes storage volumes as defined by the system-supplied logical volume manager and class drivers that create device objects to represent storage volumes, such as the system disk class driver.

member.name: F:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids.System
member.remarks: This class includes HALs, system buses, system bridges, the system ACPI driver, and the system volume manager driver.

member.name: F:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids.TapeDrive
member.remarks: This class includes tape drives, including all tape miniclass drivers.

member.name: F:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids.USBDevice
member.remarks: USBDevice includes all USB devices that do not belong to another class. This class is not used for USB host controllers and hubs.

member.name: F:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids.WCEUSBS
member.remarks: This class includes Windows CE ActiveSync devices. The WCEUSBS setup class supports communication between a personal computer and a device that is compatible with the Windows CE ActiveSync driver (generally, PocketPC devices) over USB.

member.name: F:RdpConnection.DeviceSetupClassGuids.WPD
member.remarks: (Windows Vista and later versions of Windows) This class includes WPD devices.

member.name: T:RdpConnection.RdpAllowedValuesAttribute
member.summary: This attribute is used to specify the allowed values for a property.

member.name: M:RdpConnection.RdpAllowedValuesAttribute.#ctor(System.Object[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:RdpConnection.RdpAllowedValuesAttribute.IsValid(System.Object)
member.summary: Check if the object is valid.
member.returns: If the object is valid, return true; otherwise, return false.

member.name: M:RdpConnection.RdpSerializer.Serialize``1(``0,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Serializes the specified instance as RDP properties.
member.typeparam: The type of the RDP properties.
member.param: Whether to throw an exception if the specified is not valid.
member.exception: Throws when the specified is not valid.
Throws when the property does not have the DataMemberAttribute.

member.name: M:RdpConnection.RdpSerializer.Deserialize``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Deserializes the specified RDP property lines to the specified type.
member.typeparam: The type of the RDP properties.
member.param: Throws an exception if the specified is not valid.
member.exception: Throws when the property does not have the DataMemberAttribute.
Throws when the specified is not valid.

member.name: M:RdpConnection.RdpSerializer.SerializeAsRdpUri``1(``0,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Serializes the specified instance as RDP URI.
member.typeparam: The type of the RDP URI properties.
member.param: Throws an exception if the specified is not valid.
member.exception: Throws when the property does not have the DataMemberAttribute.

member.name: T:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopClientProperties
member.summary: Represents the properties of a Remote Desktop Connection (RDC) client.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopClientProperties.AdministrativeSession
member.remarks: This setting configures the client computer to connect to the administrative session of the remote computer. This setting is the same as the /admin parameter used with mstsc.exe.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopClientProperties.AllowDesktopComposition
member.remarks: This setting determines whether desktop composition is enabled on the remote computer. Desktop composition is a feature in Windows that allows you to view the desktop as if it were a three-dimensional space. Desktop composition is also known as Aero Glass.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopClientProperties.AllowFontSmoothing
member.remarks: This setting determines whether font smoothing is enabled on the remote computer. Font smoothing is a feature in Windows that makes fonts appear smoother on the screen.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopClientProperties.AudioQualityMode
member.remarks: This setting determines the audio playback quality on the local computer.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopClientProperties.AutoReconnectMaxRetries
member.remarks: This setting determines the maximum number of times the client computer will automatically try to reconnect to the remote computer if the connection is dropped, for example, when there is an interruption of network connectivity.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopClientProperties.BitmapCachePersistEnable
member.remarks: This setting determines whether bitmaps are cached on the local computer. Bitmap caching can improve the performance of your remote session by storing frequently used images on the local computer.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopClientProperties.ConnectionType
member.remarks: This setting configures the client computerâ€™s connection speed. This setting corresponds to the selections for Choose your connection speed to optimize performance on the Experience tab under Options in Remote Desktop Connection.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopClientProperties.DisableCtrlAltDel
member.remarks: This setting determines whether the CTRL+ALT+DELETE security attention sequence is required to enter credentials after you are connected to the remote computer.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopClientProperties.DisablePrinterRedirection
member.remarks: This setting determines whether Easy Print printer redirection is enabled when connecting to the remote computer.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopClientProperties.DisableClipboardRedirection
member.remarks: This setting determines whether Clipboard redirection is enabled when connecting to the remote computer.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopClientProperties.DisableCursorSettings
member.remarks: This setting determines whether the cursor settings are disabled when connecting to the remote computer.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopClientProperties.DisableWallpaper
member.remarks: This setting determines whether the wallpaper is disabled when connecting to the remote computer.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopClientProperties.DisableFullWindowDrag
member.remarks: This setting determines whether full window drag is disabled when connecting to the remote computer.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopClientProperties.DisableMenuAnimations
member.remarks: This setting determines whether menu animation effects are disabled when connecting to the remote computer.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopClientProperties.DisableThemes
member.remarks: This setting determines whether themes are disabled when connecting to the remote computer.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopClientProperties.DisplayConnectionBar
member.remarks: This setting determines whether the connection bar appears when you are in full screen mode when you connect to a remote computer by using Remote Desktop Connection (RDC). This setting corresponds to the Display the connection bar when I use the full screen check box on the Display tab under Options in RDC.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopClientProperties.EnableWorkspaceReconnect
member.remarks: This setting determines whether the client computer will attempt to reconnect to the remote computer if the connection is dropped. This setting corresponds to the Reconnect if the connection is dropped check box on the General tab under Options in Remote Desktop Connection (RDC).

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopClientProperties.GatewayBrokeringType
member.remarks: This setting determines the type of gateway brokering that will be used when connecting to the remote computer. This setting corresponds to the Gateway brokering type drop-down list on the Advanced tab under Options in Remote Desktop Connection (RDC).

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopClientProperties.KdcProxyName
member.remarks: Specifies the fully qualified domain name of a KDC proxy.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopClientProperties.LoadBalanceInfo
member.remarks: This setting specifies the provider name, endpoint type, and an endpoint. Load-balancing information used to choose the best server for the client computer. For more information about LoadBalanceInfo, see (https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aa381177(VS.85).aspx).

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopClientProperties.NegotiateSecurityLayer
member.remarks: This setting determines whether or not RDP negotiates the security layer.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopClientProperties.PinConnectionBar
member.remarks: This setting determines whether or not the connection bar should be pinned to the top of the remote session upon connection.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopClientProperties.PromptForCredentials
member.remarks: This setting determines whether or not Remote Desktop Connection (RDC) prompts for credentials when connecting to a server that does not support server authentication.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopClientProperties.RdgIsKdcProxy
member.remarks: This setting determines whether the Remote Desktop Gateway (RDG) is acting as a Key Distribution Center (KDC) proxy.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopClientProperties.RedirectDrives
member.remarks: This setting determines whether drives on the client computer will be redirected and available in the remote session when you connect to a remote computer by using Remote Desktop Connection (RDC). This setting corresponds to the selections for Drives under More on the Local Resources tab under Options in RDC.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopClientProperties.RedirectPosDevices
member.remarks: This setting determines whether printers on the client computer will be redirected and available in the remote session when you connect to a remote computer by using Remote Desktop Connection (RDC). This setting corresponds to the selections for Printers under More on the Local Resources tab under Options in RDC.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopClientProperties.ServerPort
member.remarks: This setting determines which TCP port the Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) will use when you connect to the remote computer by using Remote Desktop Connection (RDC). The default value is 0xD3D (3389).

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopClientProperties.SessionBpp
member.remarks: This setting determines the color depth on the remote computer when you connect by using Remote Desktop Connection (RDC). This setting corresponds to the selection in the Colors drop-down list on the Display tab under Options in RDC.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopClientProperties.ShellWorkingDirectory
member.remarks: This setting specifies the working directory on the remote computer where the Remote Desktop Connection (RDC) window will start.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopClientProperties.SpanMonitors
member.remarks: This setting determines whether the remote session window will be spanned across multiple monitors when you connect to the remote computer by using Remote Desktop Connection (RDC).

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopClientProperties.UseRedirectionServerName
member.remarks: This setting determines whether the Remote Desktop Connection (RDC) client will use the redirection server name when connecting to the remote computer.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopClientProperties.WindowPositionString
member.remarks: This setting specifies the position of the Remote Desktop Connection (RDC) window on the client computer. Represents a string form of the WINDOWSPOS structure. For more information about the WINDOWSPOS function, see https://msdn2.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms632612.aspx. The default value is 0,3,0,0,800,600.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopClientProperties.WorkspaceId
member.remarks: This setting defines the RemoteApp and Desktop ID associated with the RDP file that contains this setting.

member.name: M:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopClientProperties.SetWindowPosition(RdpConnection.WindowPosition)
member.remarks: If the window position is null, the default value is set to 0,3,0,0,800,600.

member.name: T:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopPropertiesBase
member.summary: Represents the base properties for a remote desktop connection.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopPropertiesBase.EnableRdsAzureAdAuth
member.remarks: Determines whether the client will use Microsoft Entra ID to authenticate to the remote PC. In Azure Virtual Desktop, this provides a single sign-on experience. This property replaces the property targetisaadjoined.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopPropertiesBase.EnableCredSspSupport
member.remarks: Determines whether the client will use the Credential Security Support Provider (CredSSP) for authentication if it's available.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopPropertiesBase.AlternateShell
member.remarks: Specifies a program to be started automatically in the remote session as the shell instead of explorer.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopPropertiesBase.AutoReconnectionEnabled
member.remarks: Determines whether the client will automatically try to reconnect to the remote computer if the connection is dropped, such as when there's a network connectivity interruption.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopPropertiesBase.BandwidthAutoDetect
member.remarks: Determines whether or not to use automatic network bandwidth detection. Requires bandwidthautodetect to be set to 1.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopPropertiesBase.NetworkAutoDetect
member.remarks: Determines whether automatic network type detection is enabled.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopPropertiesBase.Compression
member.remarks: Determines whether bulk compression is enabled when it's transmitted by RDP to the local computer.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopPropertiesBase.VideoPlaybackMode
member.remarks: Determines if the connection will use RDP-efficient multimedia streaming for video playback.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopPropertiesBase.AudioCaptureMode
member.remarks: Indicates whether audio input redirection is enabled.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopPropertiesBase.EncodedRedirectedVideoCapture
member.remarks: Enables or disables encoding of redirected video.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopPropertiesBase.RedirectedVideoCaptureEncodingQuality
member.remarks: Controls the quality of encoded video.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopPropertiesBase.AudioMode
member.remarks: Determines whether the local or remote machine plays audio.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopPropertiesBase.CamerasToRedirect
member.remarks: Configures which cameras to redirect. This setting uses a semicolon-delimited list of KSCATEGORY_VIDEO_CAMERA interfaces of cameras enabled for redirection.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopPropertiesBase.DevicesToRedirect
member.summary: Media Transfer Protocol (MTP) and Picture Transfer Protocol (PTP) redirection
member.remarks: Determines which devices on the local computer will be redirected and available in the remote session.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopPropertiesBase.DrivesToRedirect
member.remarks: Determines which disk drives on the local computer will be redirected and available in the remote session.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopPropertiesBase.KeyboardHook
member.remarks: Determines when Windows key combinations (Windows, Alt+Tab) are applied to the remote session for desktop and RemoteApp connections.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopPropertiesBase.RedirectClipboard
member.remarks: Determines whether clipboard redirection is enabled.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopPropertiesBase.RedirectCOMPorts
member.remarks: Determines whether COM (serial) ports on the local computer will be redirected and available in the remote session.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopPropertiesBase.RedirectLocation
member.remarks: Determines whether the location of the local device will be redirected and available in the remote session.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopPropertiesBase.RedirectPrinters
member.remarks: Determines whether printers configured on the local computer will be redirected and available in the remote session.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopPropertiesBase.RedirectSmartCards
member.remarks: Determines whether smart card devices on the local computer will be redirected and available in the remote session.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopPropertiesBase.RedirectWebAuthn
member.remarks: Determines whether WebAuthn requests on the remote computer will be redirected to the local computer allowing the use of local authenticators (such as Windows Hello for Business and security key).

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopPropertiesBase.UsbDevicesToRedirect
member.remarks: Determines which supported RemoteFX USB devices on the client computer will be redirected and available in the remote session when you connect to a remote session that supports RemoteFX USB redirection.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopPropertiesBase.UseMultipleMonitors
member.remarks: Determines whether the remote session will use one or multiple displays from the local computer.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopPropertiesBase.SelectedMonitors
member.remarks: Specifies which local displays to use from the remote session. The selected displays must be contiguous. Requires use multimon to be set to 1. Only available on the Windows Inbox(MSTSC) and Windows Desktop(MSRDC) clients.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopPropertiesBase.MaximizeToCurrentDisplays
member.remarks: Determines which display the remote session goes full screen on when maximizing. Requires use multimon to be set to 1. Only available on the Windows Desktop(MSRDC) client.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopPropertiesBase.SingleMonitorInWindowedMode
member.remarks: Determines whether a multi display remote session automatically switches to single display when exiting full screen. Requires use multimon to be set to 1. Only available on the Windows Desktop(MSRDC) client.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopPropertiesBase.ScreenModeId
member.remarks: Determines whether the remote session window appears full screen when you launch the connection.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopPropertiesBase.SmartSizing
member.remarks: Determines whether or not the local computer scales the content of the remote session to fit the window size.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopPropertiesBase.DynamicResolution
member.remarks: Determines whether the resolution of the remote session is automatically updated when the local window is resized.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopPropertiesBase.DesktopSizeId
member.remarks: Specifies the dimensions of the remote session desktop from a set of predefined options. This setting is overridden if desktopheight and desktopwidth are specified.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopPropertiesBase.DesktopHeight
member.remarks: Specifies the resolution height (in pixels) of the remote session.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopPropertiesBase.DesktopWidth
member.remarks: Specifies the resolution width (in pixels) of the remote session.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopPropertiesBase.DesktopScaleFactor
member.remarks: Specifies the scale factor of the remote session to make the content appear larger.

member.name: M:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopPropertiesBase.GetCamerasToRedirect
member.returns: A string collection of cameras to redirect. Semi-colon delimited.

member.name: M:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopPropertiesBase.SetCamerasToRedirect(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.param: A collection of cameras to redirect. Semi-colon delimited.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopPropertiesBase.RedirectAllCameras
member.summary: Check if all cameras are to be redirected. if is set to "*", this property will return true.

member.name: M:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopPropertiesBase.SetRedirectAllCameras
member.summary: Set all cameras to be redirected.

member.name: M:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopPropertiesBase.SetDevicesToRedirect(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.param: A collection of cameras to redirect. Semi-colon delimited.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopPropertiesBase.RedirectAllDevices
member.summary: Check if all devices are to be redirected. if is set to "*", this property will return true.

member.name: M:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopPropertiesBase.SetRedirectAllDevices
member.summary: Set all devices to be redirected.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopPropertiesBase.RedirectDynamicDevices
member.summary: Check if dynamic devices are to be redirected. if is set to "DynamicDevices", this property will return true.

member.name: M:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopPropertiesBase.SetRedirectDynamicDevices
member.summary: Set dynamic devices to be redirected.

member.name: M:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopPropertiesBase.GetDrivesToRedirect
member.returns: A string collection of drives to redirect. Semi-colon delimited.

member.summary: Check if all drives are to be redirected. if is set to "*", this property will return true.

member.summary: Check if dynamic drives are to be redirected. if is set to "DynamicDrives", this property will return true.`

member.name: T:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopServiceProperties
member.summary: Represents the properties of a Remote Desktop Service connection.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopServiceProperties.FullAddress
member.remarks: This setting specifies the hostname or IP address of the remote computer that you want to connect to. This is the only required setting in an RDP file.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopServiceProperties.AlternateFullAddress
member.summary: Alternate address of the remote computer.
member.remarks: Specifies an alternate name or IP address of the remote computer.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopServiceProperties.Username
member.remarks: Specifies the name of the user account that will be used to sign in to the remote computer.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopServiceProperties.Domain
member.remarks: Specifies the name of the domain in which the user account that will be used to sign in to the remote computer is located.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopServiceProperties.GatewayHostName
member.remarks: Specifies the RD Gateway host name.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopServiceProperties.GatewayCredentialsSource
member.remarks: Specifies when to use an RD Gateway for the connection.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopServiceProperties.GatewayProfileUsageMethod
member.remarks: Specifies whether to use default RD Gateway settings.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopServiceProperties.GatewayUsageMethod
member.remarks: Specifies when to use an RD Gateway for the connection.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopServiceProperties.PromptCredntialOnce
member.remarks: Determines whether a user's credentials are saved and used for both the RD Gateway and the remote computer.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopServiceProperties.AuthenticationLevel
member.remarks: Defines the server authentication level settings.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopServiceProperties.DisableConnectionSharing
member.remarks: Determines whether the client reconnects to any existing disconnected session or initiate a new connection when a new connection is launched.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopServiceProperties.RemoteApplicationCommandLine
member.remarks: Optional command-line parameters for the RemoteApp.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopServiceProperties.RemoteApplicationExpandCommaneLine
member.remarks: Determines whether environment variables contained in the RemoteApp command-line parameter should be expanded locally or remotely.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopServiceProperties.RemoteApplicationExpandWorkingDirectory
member.remarks: Determines whether environment variables contained in the RemoteApp working directory parameter should be expanded locally or remotely.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopServiceProperties.RemoteApplicationFile
member.remarks: Specifies a file to be opened on the remote computer by the RemoteApp. For local files to be opened, you must also enable drive redirection for the source drive.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopServiceProperties.RemoteApplicationIcon
member.remarks: Specifies the icon file to be displayed in the client UI while launching a RemoteApp. If no file name is specified, the client will use the standard Remote Desktop icon. Only .ico files are supported.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopServiceProperties.RemoteApplicationMode
member.remarks: Determines whether a connection is launched as a RemoteApp session.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopServiceProperties.RemoteApplicationName
member.remarks: Specifies the name of the RemoteApp in the client interface while starting the RemoteApp.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopServiceProperties.RemoteApplicationProgram
member.remarks: Specifies the alias or executable name of the RemoteApp.

member.name: T:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopUriProperties
member.summary: Represents the properties of a Remote Desktop connection URI.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopUriProperties.FullAddress
member.remarks: This setting specifies the hostname or IP address of the remote computer that you want to connect to. This is the only required setting in an RDP file.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopUriProperties.AllowDesktopComposition
member.remarks: This setting determines whether desktop composition is allowed in the remote session. Desktop composition is a feature in Windows that allows apps to draw better quality images on the screen. This setting corresponds to the Allow desktop composition check box on the Experience tab under Options in Remote Desktop Connection (RDC).

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopUriProperties.AllowFontSmoothing
member.remarks: This setting determines whether font smoothing is allowed in the remote session. Font smoothing is a feature in Windows that makes fonts appear smoother on the screen. This setting corresponds to the Allow font smoothing check box on the Experience tab under Options in Remote Desktop Connection (RDC).

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopUriProperties.AlternateShell
member.remarks: Specifies a program to be started automatically in the remote session as the shell instead of explorer.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopUriProperties.AudioMode
member.remarks: Determines whether the local or remote machine plays audio.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopUriProperties.AuthenticationLevel
member.remarks: Defines the server authentication level settings.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopUriProperties.ConnectToConsole
member.remarks: This setting determines whether the remote session connects to the console session of the remote computer. The console session is the session that is physically connected to the computer. This setting corresponds to the Connect to console check box on the General tab under Options in Remote Desktop Connection (RDC).

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopUriProperties.DisableCursorSettings
member.remarks: This setting determines whether cursor settings are disabled in the remote session. Cursor settings include cursor blinking, cursor shadow, and cursor trails. This setting corresponds to the Display the pointer trails check box on the Pointer tab under Options in Remote Desktop Connection (RDC).

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopUriProperties.DisableFullWindowDrag
member.remarks: This setting determines whether full window drag is disabled in the remote session. Full window drag is a feature in Windows that allows you to move a window by dragging the window's title bar. This setting corresponds to the Display the pointer trails check box on the Pointer tab under Options in Remote Desktop Connection (RDC).

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopUriProperties.DisableMenuAnimations
member.remarks: This setting determines whether menu animation effects are disabled in the remote session. Menu animation effects include fading or sliding menus. This setting corresponds to the Show window contents while dragging check box on the Experience tab under Options in Remote Desktop Connection (RDC).

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopUriProperties.DisableThemes
member.remarks: This setting determines whether themes are disabled in the remote session. Themes include visual styles, background images, and colors. This setting corresponds to the Themes check box on the Experience tab under Options in Remote Desktop Connection (RDC).

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopUriProperties.DisableWallpaper
member.remarks: This setting determines whether wallpaper is disabled in the remote session. Wallpaper includes background images and colors. This setting corresponds to the Desktop background check box on the Experience tab under Options in Remote Desktop Connection (RDC).

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopUriProperties.DrivesToRedirect
member.remarks: Determines which disk drives on the local computer will be redirected and available in the remote session.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopUriProperties.DesktopHeight
member.remarks: Specifies the resolution height (in pixels) of the remote session.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopUriProperties.DesktopWidth
member.remarks: Specifies the resolution width (in pixels) of the remote session.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopUriProperties.Domain
member.remarks: Specifies the name of the domain in which the user account that will be used to sign in to the remote computer is located.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopUriProperties.GatewayHostName
member.remarks: Specifies the RD Gateway host name.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopUriProperties.GatewayUsageMethod
member.remarks: Specifies when to use an RD Gateway for the connection.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopUriProperties.PromptForCredentialsOnClient
member.remarks: This setting determines whether or not Remote Desktop Connection (RDC) prompts for credentials when connecting to a server that does not support server authentication.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopUriProperties.LoadBalanceInfo
member.remarks: This setting specifies the provider name, endpoint type, and an endpoint. Load-balancing information used to choose the best server for the client computer. For more information about LoadBalanceInfo, see (https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aa381177(VS.85).aspx).

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopUriProperties.RedirectPrinters
member.remarks: Determines whether printers configured on the local computer will be redirected and available in the remote session.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopUriProperties.RemoteApplicationCommandLine
member.remarks: Optional command-line parameters for the RemoteApp.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopUriProperties.RemoteApplicationMode
member.remarks: Determines whether a connection is launched as a RemoteApp session.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopUriProperties.ShellWorkingDirectory
member.remarks: This setting specifies the starting directory for the RemoteApp.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopUriProperties.UseRedirectionServerName
member.remarks: This setting determines whether the redirection server name is used in the remote session.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopUriProperties.Username
member.remarks: Specifies the name of the user account that will be used to sign in to the remote computer.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopUriProperties.ScreenModeId
member.remarks: Determines whether the remote session window appears full screen when you launch the connection.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopUriProperties.SessionBpp
member.remarks: This setting determines the color depth on the remote computer when you connect by using Remote Desktop Connection (RDC). This setting corresponds to the selection in the Colors drop-down list on the Display tab under Options in RDC.

member.name: P:RdpConnection.RemoteDesktopUriProperties.UseMultipleMonitors
member.remarks: Determines whether the remote session will use one or multiple displays from the local computer.

member.name: T:RdpConnection.SetWindowPositionFlags
member.summary: Represents the flags that can be used when setting the position of a window.

member.name: F:RdpConnection.SetWindowPositionFlags.AsyncWindowPosition
member.summary: If the calling thread and the thread that owns the window are attached to different input queues, the system posts the request to the thread that owns the window. This prevents the calling thread from blocking its execution while other threads process the request.

member.name: F:RdpConnection.SetWindowPositionFlags.DeferErase
member.summary: Prevents generation of the WM_SYNCPAINT message.

member.name: F:RdpConnection.SetWindowPositionFlags.DrawFrame
member.summary: Draws a frame (defined in the window's class description) around the window.

member.name: F:RdpConnection.SetWindowPositionFlags.FrameChanged
member.summary: Applies new frame styles set using the SetWindowLong function. Sends a WM_NCCALCSIZE message to the window, even if the window's size is not being changed. If this flag is not specified, WM_NCCALCSIZE is sent only when the window's size is being changed.

member.name: F:RdpConnection.SetWindowPositionFlags.NoActivate
member.summary: Does not activate the window. If this flag is not set, the window is activated and moved to the top of either the topmost or non-topmost group (depending on the setting of the hWndInsertAfter parameter).

member.name: F:RdpConnection.SetWindowPositionFlags.NoCopyBits
member.summary: Discards the entire contents of the client area. If this flag is not specified, the valid contents of the client area are saved and copied back into the client area after the window is sized or repositioned.

member.name: F:RdpConnection.SetWindowPositionFlags.NoMove
member.summary: Retains the current position (ignores X and Y parameters).

member.name: F:RdpConnection.SetWindowPositionFlags.NoOwnerZOrder
member.summary: Does not change the owner window's position in the Z order.

member.name: F:RdpConnection.SetWindowPositionFlags.NoRedraw
member.summary: Does not redraw changes. If this flag is set, no repainting of any kind occurs. This applies to the client area, the nonclient area (including the title bar and scroll bars), and any part of the parent window uncovered as a result of the window being moved. When this flag is set, the application must explicitly invalidate or redraw any parts of the window and parent window that need redrawing.

member.name: F:RdpConnection.SetWindowPositionFlags.NoSendChanging
member.summary: Prevents the window from receiving the WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGING message.

member.name: F:RdpConnection.SetWindowPositionFlags.NoSize
member.summary: Retains the current size (ignores the cx and cy parameters).

member.name: F:RdpConnection.SetWindowPositionFlags.NoZOrder
member.summary: Retains the current Z order (ignores the hWndInsertAfter parameter).

member.name: T:RdpConnection.WindowPosition
member.summary: Represents the position of a window.

member.name: M:RdpConnection.WindowPosition.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Represents the position of a window as a string. (Handle, Window State, Left, Top, Right, Bottom)

member.name: M:RdpConnection.WindowPosition.ToString
member.summary: Converts the value of this instance to a .
member.returns: String representation of the window position. (Handle, Window State, Left, Top, Right, Bottom)
